p: A microneutralisation (MN) assay was performed and interpreted according to the 2-day enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay protocol of the World Health Organisation [ 20, 21]. Serum samples were serially diluted by two-fold from 1:20 to 1:2560. Viral antigen was detected using anti-nucleoprotein antibody [ 22]. All viruses used in the MN assay were cultured in Madin Darby canine kidney cells as we described previously [ 12], to avoid mutations that may arise during egg passage. The haemagglutinin (HA) gene of the virus stocks used for the MN assay was sequenced.
